verses.text_plain: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.
verses.verse_html: 1In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

verses.text_plain: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.
verses.verse_html: 2Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

verses.text_plain: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
verses.verse_html:
3Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress. ▼
▼ Be…: Heb. Be thou to me for a rock of habitation

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Be…: Heb. Be thou to me for a rock of habitation
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Be…: Heb. Be thou to me for a rock of habitation

verses.text_plain: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
verses.verse_html: 4Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

verses.text_plain: For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.
verses.verse_html: 5For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.

verses.text_plain: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.
verses.verse_html: 6By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.

tokens.text: By thee have I been holden up

verses.text_plain: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.
verses.verse_html: 7I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.

verses.text_plain: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.
verses.verse_html: 8Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.

verses.text_plain: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
verses.verse_html: 9Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

verses.text_plain: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,
verses.verse_html:
10For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together, ▼
▼ lay…: Heb. watch, or, observe

tokens.text: against me; and they that lay wait

footnotes.body_html: ▼ lay…: Heb. watch, or, observe

verses.text_plain: Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.
verses.verse_html: 11Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.

verses.text_plain: O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.
verses.verse_html: 12O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.

verses.text_plain: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.
verses.verse_html: 13Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.

verses.text_plain: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.
verses.verse_html: 14But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.

verses.text_plain: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.
verses.verse_html: 15My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.

verses.text_plain: I will go in the strength of the Lord God: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
verses.verse_html: 16I will go in the strength of the Lord God: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.

verses.text_plain: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.
verses.verse_html: 17O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.

verses.text_plain: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.
verses.verse_html:
18Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come. ▼
▼ when…: Heb. unto old age and gray hairs
 , ▼
▼ thy strength: Heb. thine arm

tokens.text: me not; until I have shewed

footnotes.body_text: ▼ when…: Heb. unto old age and gray hairs
footnotes.body_html: ▼ when…: Heb. unto old age and gray hairs
▼ thy strength: Heb. thine arm

verses.text_plain: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!
verses.verse_html: 19Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!

verses.text_plain: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
verses.verse_html: 20Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.
verses.verse_html: 21Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

verses.text_plain: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
verses.verse_html:
22I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel. ▼
▼ the psaltery: Heb. the instrument of psaltery

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the psaltery: Heb. the instrument of psaltery
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the psaltery: Heb. the instrument of psaltery

verses.text_plain: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
verses.verse_html: 23My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

verses.text_plain: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.
verses.verse_html: 24My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.

tokens.text: for they are brought unto shame
